posts.text: As Superbowl Sunday looms—with $1.67 billion in bets expected—Americans need protection against online sports betting companies & prediction markets that exploit problem gamblers. My legislation is a start.

posts.text: Profligate Big Tech must bear the societal costs of its skyrocketing AI spending—rising costs of electricity, water, construction, & much more. Companies not consumers should pay. Bipartisan legislation must impose accountability. I’m working on it.

replies.text:
As complexity increases at an expanding rate, We will need an increasingly advanced government. I am suggesting we make big tech fund a 4th branch of government.

It should specialize in empirical data and offer guardianship over our scientific integrity.

Each bit of data will incur a cost on us.

posts.text: Nationalizing elections would be brazenly unconstitutional & totalitarian—the threat itself deeply chilling, added to bullying about voter rolls, voting machines, poll workers, ICE police state tactics, Fulton County antics, & more. America should be afraid, very afraid.

replies.text:
Say the words; 🔥Abolish DHS and abolish ICE🔥

No one wants to live in Stephen Miller's wet dream or an Epstein-class world.

⚠️It's all connected.⚠️

We, and Democrats in power, must be ruthless and resolute about its destruction or our future selves will long for the hope and freedom we have today.

Not afraid.
Angry.
We’re not afraid.  We’re determined to fight Trump.  Do better.

"The world is bad! Woe is me!"

FFS, Senator! People don't think Democrats will DO anything. It's a terrible media strategy to post these empty laments.

Tell us what YOU'RE doing. Tell us how we can help. How will you rebuild? Will there be accountability?

We need more than this.

I am afraid of Democratic Senators who send out these empty posts without taking a stand. Democracy has been eroding at a rapid pace- why haven’t you offered legislation that overrides Citizens United and bans foreign agents like AIPAC from buying elections for their agents (like you.)
We are afraid, and have been. That's why you need to work a lot harder to fix this.
